In Greece, protesters block the Finance Ministry where government officials are meeting for talks on the financial crisis.
In Geneva, the World Health Organization says a drug - resistant strain of E. coli bacteria has killed 18 people.
Government forces in Yemen clash with opposition fighters trying to link up with allies in the capital, Sanaa.
In Syria, rights activists blame the government for the deaths of children in an anti - government protest.
US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, describes as "very serious", claims that Chinese hackers broke into Google e-mail accounts.
In the US, Sukanya Roy wins the National Spelling Bee and 40,000 dollars in prizes.
